intro: Phyllostegia haplostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
